<?php
require_once 'wordpress/wp-load.php';

// Create sample posts with various ages to demonstrate the plugin
$sample_posts = array(
    array(
        'title' => 'Welcome to Our Blog',
        'days_old' => 30,
        'content' => 'This is a recent blog post that should appear as fresh content.'
    ),
    array(
        'title' => 'Getting Started Guide',
        'days_old' => 120,
        'content' => 'This post is a few months old and shows as aging content.'
    ),
    array(
        'title' => 'Company History',
        'days_old' => 250,
        'content' => 'This is stale content that needs to be reviewed and updated.'
    ),
    array(
        'title' => 'Product Features Overview',
        'days_old' => 400,
        'content' => 'This very old post demonstrates how the plugin identifies stale content.'
    ),
    array(
        'title' => 'Latest News Update',
        'days_old' => 7,
        'content' => 'Very recent content that appears as fresh.'
    ),
    array(
        'title' => 'Annual Report Summary',
        'days_old' => 365,
        'content' => 'Content from a year ago that definitely needs attention.'
    ),
    array(
        'title' => 'Team Introduction',
        'days_old' => 200,
        'content' => 'Stale content about the team that should be updated.'
    ),
    array(
        'title' => 'Services We Offer',
        'days_old' => 90,
        'content' => 'Content approaching staleness threshold.'
    )
);

foreach ($sample_posts as $post_data) {
    $post_date = date('Y-m-d H:i:s', strtotime('-' . $post_data['days_old'] . ' days'));
    
    wp_insert_post(array(
        'post_title'    => $post_data['title'],
        'post_content'  => $post_data['content'],
        'post_status'   => 'publish',
        'post_type'     => 'post',
        'post_date'     => $post_date,
        'post_date_gmt' => get_gmt_from_date($post_date)
    ));
}

// Create a sample page too
wp_insert_post(array(
    'post_title'    => 'About Us',
    'post_content'  => 'This page is old and needs updating.',
    'post_status'   => 'publish',
    'post_type'     => 'page',
    'post_date'     => date('Y-m-d H:i:s', strtotime('-300 days')),
    'post_date_gmt' => get_gmt_from_date(date('Y-m-d H:i:s', strtotime('-300 days')))
));

echo 'Sample content created successfully!';
